So starting off with the build it's almost perfect 9/10, trust me the finishing on this thing is top notch but the hinge coulve been more opened to about 120 degrees instead of the 90 degrees.              

The looks of the earbuds itself is awesome it's shiny texture looks really cool and I'll give it a 9/10 as well

The Active Noise Cancellation (ANC) is not like airpods level but still considering it's price, it blocks the fan noise and the outside noise however the conversations and people talking can be heard like 50 percent so only about a 7.5 or an 8 on this one

The mic is average but it's Environmental Noise Cancelation(ENC) works great and block background noises so 8/10

Overall great product 8.5/10, this is probably the best for this price (1900) 

Edit: had seen a lot of backlash for the hinge but no problem has been seen in mine

There is a small problem with these earbuds, either in their design or functionality. Sometimes, the earbuds don’t connect automatically. The build quality of the earbuds themselves is good, but in my opinion, the case’s build quality is not. The case’s lid is loose; unlike other earbuds, it doesn’t have a proper locking mechanism. Normally, when you open the case and move it, the lid stays in place, but with this one, it closes too easily. That’s why I think the case’s build quality is poor.

On the other hand, the sound quality of the earbuds is decent, and the game mode is excellent. Also, you can check the video.

Honestly Reviewing After A Month
- One of the best earbud of Ultima.
- Comfortable while wearing. 
- Sano tino disturbance le frak na parne.
- Base Khatarnak (Best For Music)😍  
- ANC Babal ❤️
- Gaming Experience: Good (Gaming ko lagi 30 ms ko earbud perfect hunx , but yetiko budget ma 40 ms is good)

NOTE:- 
- Ultima Atom 192 kinne soch ma hunuunxa vane wait halka budget thapnus tara Ultima Boom 141 Linu hola. It is far better than other earbud of Ultima 

- Call garne bela tapaiko aawaj aru lai ali moto janxa but good if you don't use earbuds more while talking 

- Honestly saying, yetiko features bhyaeko earbud aru company ko linu hunx vane you have to pay around 4000 rupees or more than that. So use Nepalese Product instead of using others ☺️

Also the ANC isn't that much great, I can get distracted by sudden noise.

Reviewing after 1 week of usage:
I got it at Rs 1699 only. The sound quality is really impressive with different modes like ANC, Gaming, Normal, Transparency. In Gaming mode I have played PUBG and I did't notice any audio delay. The game was playable. Battery life is also really good on this. I would definitely suggest everyone who are looking for a budget earbuds.

Sound quality is average, ANC isnt that exceptional which is fine for a product at this price point but if you are seriously wanting something with good ANC then you should probably look elsewhere. Battery life is as advertised..it has lasted me for a couple of months now and is still going strong.. so good quality...overall a decent jack-of-all wireless earbuds for casual listening but not intended for people who take their audio quality seriously

Only after 5 months , one of the bud stopped working. It wasn't possible to claim its warranty because of the location. But let me teel you what was the problem. inside the earbud there is small magnet and it is attached with very thin glue. Even small degree of temperature literally melts it (don't wear it with cap) and magnet sticks with the metal plate leaving it's position. It destroyed the bud making impossible to repair as its frame gets destroyed when you force it open. It's frustrating.

😗I really love the Ultima Atom 192. It is the best earbuds there is in this price range.The thing I liked the most about it is that Crazy Noise cancellation. I guess it's 100% noise cancellation 😂. They say it's sweat proof. Maila vaada majda 5-6 choti pani ma dubi sakyo😬. It's still perfectly fine though. Audio quality ramro vayera batoma boring ebook Sunda ni full concentrate hunxa Vanya😂.

Jokes aside, it's been 5 months since I bought this and it is still like new. Audio quality is awesome. Battery Backup is still over 35 hours. The delivery was also very fast and good. They also provide you with two extra earplugs thingy of different size. You can choose the perfect size for you. The touch sensors are also pretty good. Don't lower your expectations just cuz it's a Nepali product. I'm sure that if I upgrade I'll still choose Ultima.

Finally, I got a special gift from Ultima that I'm yet to recieve, but I'm sure they'll send it to me after reading this👀.

Ultima Atom 192 Earbuds Review (Dashain Offer)

I bought the Ultima Atom 192 earbuds during a Dashain offer for Rs. 2799, with a buy one, get one free deal. I’ve previously used the Ultima Atom 520, in the same type of offer which was cheaper at Rs. 2400, and I own four other Ultima products that have worked well for me. However, I’m not happy with the Atom 192.

Main Issues:

1. The sound quality is not great, especially if you’re used to 10mm drivers. There’s hardly any bass, so the sound feels weak.

2. You can’t change the volume without using your phone or device, which is inconvenient.

The only good thing is the long battery life, but the sound and features are not as good as the Atom 520.

If you care about sound quality, especially if you’ve used 10mm driver earbuds before, I wouldn’t recommend the Atom 192. You can save your money or go for the Atom 520, which is better and cheaper.

I bought the Ultima 192 earbuds four months ago, attracted by the Nepali brand and positive reviews (200+ reviews). However, my experience left me disappointed.

The materials felt cheap and lacked durability. Sound quality was subpar, failing to meet expectations. The battery backup was impressive, though.

After two months, the earbuds exhibited a frustrating issue—automatic connection(not regularly appear) and playback even when in the box(cleaning charger points, checking lid connection also doesn't work). Warranty assistance required costly courier fees, adding to the dissatisfaction.

I used these earbuds for gym and jogging, but they produced an annoying tick-tock sound. Trying different earplugs helped but remained inconvenient.

In summary, the Ultima192 earbuds disappointed me with their cheap build,mediocre sound, connectivity issues, and cumbersome warranty process.While the battery life impressed, I can't recommend them.Consider exploring other options for reliable earbuds

I recently purchased the Ultima Earbuds from Daraz and would rate them as fairly average. 

The sound quality is decent, offering clear audio for both calls and music. However, the bass feels a bit underwhelming, which might not satisfy those looking for a deeper sound experience. The battery life is acceptable, lasting around 4-5 hours per charge, but I had hoped for better longevity. The design is sleek and lightweight, making them comfortable to wear for extended periods. Unfortunately, the connection sometimes drops unexpectedly, which can be frustrating during calls. Overall, the Ultima Earbuds are a decent option for casual users, but they fall short in some areas. 

For the price, they’re a reasonable buy, but don’t expect premium performance.

Honestly what else can you ask for in a tws at Rs.2699? It has a USB C port which charges at 5V 2A,it connects to bluetooth super fast and not to mention it comes with a 6 Months warranty. What else do you even want? Noise cancellation? Game mode? At 2699? Come on. The plastic top snaps super hard owing to the great magnets in this case, which is why the case top feels flimsy at times. At medium/low sound I only drained around 20% of the battery in 1 and a half hours of playing music from spotify. Obstructions distort the earphones though but that is to be expected with all earphones. Coming to sound, the fact that it even outputs sound which is audible is good enough for me. Passive noise cancellation works super well if you are playing music and walking on the street. You won't be hearing a lot of traffic. You are not making a mistake buying something like this at 2699. Cyan colour is awesome.

Let's start with packaging.The product was well packaged. I really appreciate that. Even though the material is plastic, I think it will hold up pretty good. The earbuds are pretty well built too. Talking about the fit, on the right ear it was a perfect fit but on the left I felt like not as much as the right one (but it may be due to my own ear's structure.) but it hasn't fallen once out of my ear during my 3 days of use. Long time usage lead to somewhat pain in my both ears( 4-5 hrs). Sound quality is good too. Bass is little on the lower side. It has a gaming mode but sound lags a little whatsover. I tried playing sounds using chrome browser, there a kind of jittery noise was present but Samsung browser and my own phone's browser had no issue playing sound at all. I dont know about the ANC but it has a good Passive noise cancellation. But hey I am not complaining.I am satisfied by the product within this price. Battery backup is so good and it charges so quick. Overall I loved it.

Strength isn’t just built in the gym – it starts in your grip. 💪🔥 #HandGrip #PowerInYourPalm #StrongerEveryday

A strong handgrip is a testament to overall physical strength and functional fitness. It not only enhances your ability to perform daily tasks with ease, like opening jars or carrying groceries, but also contributes to improved athletic performance in various sports, from weightlifting to rock climbing. Furthermore, a good grip can be an indicator of overall health and can even play a role in injury prevention and rehabilitation.

Cozic Soap is a premium skincare product known for its blend of natural ingredients and luxurious feel. This handcrafted soap combines the soothing properties of essential oils with gentle, nourishing elements like shea butter and coconut oil, making it ideal for sensitive and dry skin. Each bar is meticulously crafted to provide a rich, creamy lather that cleanses without stripping the skin of its natural oils. Cozic Soap is not only a treat for the skin but also a sustainable choice, with eco-friendly packaging and ethically sourced ingredients. It promises a refreshing and indulgent bathing experience that leaves the skin soft, hydrated, and delicately scented.

After use Review: 
Use gardai gaesi glue starts striping out and the glue starts sticks around the nipple area (though easily removed while bathing). 
Even after wash, the dirt gets stuck in the cover and finally as you wash it, there is no glue left. 

The product is no longer usable within two months of average use. Not a sustainable product. 
Also it doesn't cover the nipple fully, especailly if you're wearing light colored tees. 

It's far more comfortable than wearing a bra. But wish it was a little sustainable and long lasting.

This product appears visually appealing with a clean, well-crafted design. Its quality seems reliable, with attention to detail and appropriate materials. It effectively meets its purpose and creates a positive impression, making it attractive and functional for consumers.

The brush has quickly become an essential part of my hair care routine. This innovative tool has truly exceeded my expectations in providing a relaxing and effective scalp care experience.

The soft silicone bristles of the brush feel gentle and soothing on my scalp, making it a pleasure to use during shower time. I've noticed that it helps to exfoliate my scalp, removing any buildup and promoting better circulation. This, in turn, has contributed to reducing dandruff and dryness, leaving my scalp feeling refreshed and rejuvenated.

Using the scalp massager has also become a delightful way to stimulate hair growth. The gentle massaging action encourages blood flow to the hair follicles, promoting a healthier environment for hair growth. Over time, I've noticed a subtle improvement in the thickness and texture of my hair.

Overall, I highly recommend the brush for anyone looking to improve their scalp health and promote hair growth. It's a simple yet effective tool that provides a relaxing and enjoyable experience while offering tangible benefits for scalp care and hair growth.

I won't lie, according to the price, the quality is very good. However, the stiching of the hot bag pocket is quite lacking. When you put your hand underneath it or try to lift it up using the pocket, you can feel and hear the strain. it feels almost as if it will come off from the hot pack or tear. it is definitely not fur, so don't go expecting real fur pocket.

other than that, I have no complaints, you get what you pay for, and for this price, the quality is already high. The colour and design I got is also really good, and it feels cozy during winter.

would I say that this is worth buying? yes, it is. The seller service is also quite good, but if you want something longer lasting, definitely buy one from your local stationary or pharmacy.

it's a good recommendation, and a great gift item if you are looking to buy something like this for multiple people but have a limited budget.

An electric hot bag is a convenient and efficient way to keep warm on cold days. It's easy to use - simply plug it in and it will heat up in a matter of minutes. The heat is evenly distributed, providing consistent warmth all over the bag. The temperature can be easily controlled with a simple switch, allowing you to customize the heat to your comfort level. The bag is also lightweight and easy to carry, making it perfect for travel or outdoor activities. Overall, the electric hot bag is a great investment for anyone looking to stay warm and comfortable in cold weather.

Derma Roller Review – A Great Tool for Skin Improvement

A derma roller is a skincare tool designed to improve skin texture, boost collagen production, and enhance product absorption. Here’s a detailed review of a high-quality derma roller:

Build Quality & Design

A good derma roller features titanium or stainless steel micro-needles, ensuring durability and safety. The ergonomic handle makes it easy to use, and the needle size options (0.25mm to 1.5mm) allow for customization based on skin concerns.

Performance & Benefits

Boosts Collagen Production – Regular use stimulates skin regeneration, reducing fine lines, wrinkles, and acne scars.

Enhances Absorption of Skincare Products – Helps serums and creams penetrate deeper for better results.

Improves Skin Texture – Smooths rough patches and brightens dull skin.

Minimizes Pores & Hyperpigmentation – Helps in reducing dark spots and evening out skin tone.

Ease of Use & Safety

I am surprised that this cup works perfectly for me.  I have used Menstrual Cups for nearly 10 years with different brands. They did get old over the years, so I was looking for a new one.  I thought with this price, why not try an Indian brand?

To my surprise, I guess over the years, the technology of menstrual cups has improved a lot.  So the quality of this cup is just as good as all the previous international brands I used.  It didn't let me choose the hardness of the cup, but I guess this one is medium hardness, so it pops out easily and it was not too pressurising on the bladder.

One thing to note, I guess this cup (the one I bought is Small size) is suitable for low cervix ones because it is my case.  If you have a high cervix, you might find it difficult to retrieve it because the stem is short.

Another thing to note is I don't like that there is a little hole at the tip of the stem.  Because in the official photos, it is a round-top stem.

I really like these pull-ups. They aren’t regular diapers where you attach them at the sides after putting them on. They are instead one piece already connected at the sides: a pull-up. That said, most Nepali “diapers” are actually pull-ups. And these work really well. I find myself reaching for these instead of other brands at night because I am confident these won’t leak or overflow during the night. My baby sleeps well with them on and they seem to be comfortable for him. We’ve gotten them many times and will probably get them many times in the future. Highly recommended if you need pull-ups.

I recently purchased this hair oil with high hopes but I must say that I am extremely disappointed with my experience. When I received the package, I was shocked to find that the product was completely broken and there was no oil left at all. Firstly, the packaging was insufficient to protect the delicate hair oil bottle during transit. It arrived in a pitiful state, with shattered glass and oil spilled all over the package. It was evident that no care was taken to ensure the item's safe delivery. Moreover, the fact that there was absolutely no product left in the bottle is unacceptable. I paid good money for this hair oil, and to receive a completely empty bottle is nothing short of a rip-off. I am deeply unsatisfied with this purchase and the overall experience. Not only did I waste my money, but I also wasted my time and energy. I urge other customers to exercise caution when considering buying this product , as this experience has left a sour taste in my mouth.😡😡😡

Hi Sorry about this. However, we have taken 100% care from our side for packaging. We have bubbled wrapped the glass jar with 4-5 layers and packed in the box with additional corrugated cardboard. We have also mentioned Fragile on the box. Even after doing this we do face 0.01% breakage issues which be believe is mostly due to the logistics carelessness or other external factors which is not under our control. Hence, we do accept return in such situations which we believe you have already filed for. We can avoid this by packaging in plastic jars but this will further degrade the quality of our product and using plastic is not in good for environment too. We wish you for better experience with Naturo Earth next time. :)

Cetaphil is one of my favourite moisturizer. It is very good for normal to dry skin face. it is one of the first moisturizer that I have been using in my face since my teenager and unti today date. It has really keep my skin glow, soft and hydrate. It has  been 9 year since I have been using Cetaphil moisturizer and till to day date, there is no any irritation or rashes by using this moisturizer. It has really make my skin glow and hydrate. 

As I usually do not wear makeup so using Cetaphil moisturizer and sunscreen, my face always looks glow and fresh. I do not have to wear makeup at all. I really suggest Cetaphil to those who has normal to dry skin. Not only moisturizer but the cleanser is also very good one. About the price, Cetaphil moisturizer is a budget friendly moisturizer compare to other moisturizer.

So far, the keyboard doesn't disappoint... it takes a little bit of getting used to, to type properly. I used to type like 72 words per minute on my old cheap keyboard, the first time I used this I got like 42, and with a few days of getting used to I'm upto 62 but I know I can go much higher because the travel between the keys is so small and keys are very soft. it's my first time using a mechanical keyboard and I'm loving it, the sound the feel is absolutely amazing even that on this price point. 

the only thing I'll complain about is the light, no backlit keys and the light modes aren't very good, it just feels cheap. I've had mine set on the blinking mode since everything else is useless. also the brightness of the lights cannot be changed even tho.there is a dedicated button for it.

overall a very good product and you can go for it without a doubt ❤️ you just need a little bit of getting used to for the 60% keyboard

Far better than their GO model. It has an actual silent switch, bigger and comfortable size and better sensor. The mouse is slippery when lifting but that can be fixed with some grip tapes. For normal PC browsing and office use, it's good. Wouldn't recommend it for competitive gaming as there is a noticeable latency compared to a good wireless mouse say the Logitech G304 that I'm using. But overall, it is a very good daily use mouse. Recommended. 

Update: There was a thin plastic on the skid pads. Once I removed it, moving the mouse was far smoother. The mouse was more slippery to use. If you find the mouse to be resisting when moving, you might want to try it. Do be careful while removing it though, you might remove the whole skid pad.

For the price, the controller feels great. The plastic feels sturdy and strong, and it doesn't feel cheap at all. The R1, R2, L1, and L2 are analog triggers, so modern games are supported. Since it uses X-input, you can plug and play with no third-party software needed.

The only cons of this controller are:

The D-pad is very hard to press.
The full range sensitivity of the R2 and L2 triggers is very high and unstable.
The thumbstick isn’t round, as you can see in the photo, which is a personal preference.

I should have checked an online review before buying it, and I regret not doing so. The build is great, I loved how it fit in my hand. 
The gaming experience, however, took a nose dive. I thought it was me not getting used to the new mouse, and tweaked the DPIs and sensitivity hoping to find the sweet spot but I never did.
The tracker is shitt on this mouse. I have changed all the sensitivity of my FPS games because of this mouse and I hate it. 
I had to change sensitivity on MINECRAFT. MINECRAFT of all games. Over my 8 years of playing Minecraft, I never had to adjust sensitivity on Minecraft.
So yeah don't buy it. 
I'm back to playing on my old mouse, Fantech phantom x15. I'm not hating on the brand, my first fantech was x7 blast and I got Phantom x15 after that.
This is my third Fantech mouse.
I don't recommend buying this product.

This is a scam as the product has been advertised as a dual mic but the earbuds have a single mic. I bought this product thinking it would be good for the price, but after using it for a few days, it didn’t match what was advertised. The battery life is really disappointing because the most I got, including the case, was only 12 hours, which is far from the 30 hours they promised. The gaming performance is bad too, as the delay is so high that it’s almost impossible to play. The ENC feature doesn’t really work, and the microphone during calls wasn’t clear at all. Charging the device took over 2 hours, which is much slower than the company claimed. The Bluetooth version is 5.3 instead of the advertised 5.4, and the earbuds only have one mic, even though they were marketed as dual mic. On top of that, the earbuds keep getting distortions during use, which is really frustrating. Overall, I’m really unhappy with the product and you can get genuinely better earbuds at the same price.

4,5 days vayo use gareko jamma 1 choti charge gareko xu first day, battery backup ekdam ramro xa. Sound quality is fine. Earbuds herda pani ramro xa. Touch pani responsive xa. Noise cancellation ramro xaina,  Lightweight xa. Bluetooth pair pani quick hunxa tara 2,3 choti jhekjhuk wala sound aayera kaan dukhyo. Regular 1 hr jati use garda kaan dukhxa. Mobile/ laptop vanda 2,3 meter tadha jada bela bela (2/10) disconnect hunxa tara normally 7,8 meter samma pani majale connect hunxa. But price anusar performance ekdam ramro xa. 3K or 4k ma aru linu vanda yo thik xa, but budget enough vaye ta apple/ oneplus/ oppo/ samsung/ jbl, etc etc haru lida hunxa. Value for money- 5 stars xa. 
Iphone/ mac ko lagi ali premium brand nai consider garnu. Yo ni majale pair hunxa tara iphone, mac ko testo babaal sound xodera yo earbud ko sound maja lagena. But samsung ko mobile speaker vanda chai ultima ko earbud ko sound quality ramro xa.

The product is good.Fits well when worn in the ear. Full charge backup;5/6 hrs in the bud. It lasted for 4.5 hrs with continuous listening at 60-70% volume. In this case, the buds can be fully charged up to 3/4 times. When the buds are charged 3 times from 10-100%,the last indicator lights up. In my 15 days using ENC mode worked fine but don't expect much. It feels good to talk on the phone.Low latency,fine for general use.The battery drains at a rate of 10%.Overall great for listening to music.

Price ko anusar sound babaal xa, 13 mm driver le tah loudness Deko xa, connectivity ma keii ni issue aako xaina. Low latency chai xa gaming ma tah wired nai thik xa. This is best for multimedia purposes. charge haru herna baki xa ENC is also good according to price range. overally Best TWS in this price range.

Bought almost a year ago and here I am reviewing it after very  long term usage. It's been my buddy since I got. I had a tiresome experience using earphones. Playing games using this headphone on is something I would never want to do  because you can feel the lag in real time. From room to office and office to back home, it is still my great companion. It, back few months, used to format itself for no reason, now the problem doesn't exist. Could be a manufacturing defect. sound quality is decent for day to day usage and loud too. Quite loud to paralyze noise pollution of Kathmandu roads and help me dive peacefully into my songs. No complains on Battery health too. It manages to play along for a whole movie and still not dead. It's my first ever earbuds and we're doing great together. Still long journey to go. Much love Ultima. Just one complaint: Make s20 soundbox bit cheaper, I want to buy a soundbox now.

My experiences on Ultima Prime 1: 
- The ANC is quite good❤️. Didn’t know the size of eartips made that big of a difference. 
- The build looks premium🥶, and heavy, in a good way. The metallic finish looks cool.
- The sound quality is really good, audio spanning and everything. And flexible because of the equalizer.
- The app is what needs an update. Sometimes the app won’t connect and sometimes ANC mode  glitches.😔
- The game mode is my favorite feature after the ANC. The delay feels almost nonexistent in this mode❤️.
- The battery life has been good for me.

If instead of the annoying “ANC mode” sound,  a simple  chime played, it would have been a perfect 5⭐️. 

Overall, the Ultima Prime 1 is worth the price🫡.

Overall the look is premium. Everything is good as per the price. Ultima needs to improve its application  and add more customization on tap features on buds. It plays annoying sound everytime it's equalizer is switched to signature sound and balanced mode.

Pretty decent pair I'd say. For gaming it isn't bad just if u are switching from a proper Gaming headset like i did(hyperx cloud stinger) the sound will sound a little uncomfortable at first then u get used to it. That's somewhat to be expected of a earphone on a budget and specifically made for listening to music. Speaking of which bass is nice, highs leave a little more to be desired and I had to fumble with equaliser at first to try and "fix" that.
Also some sounds are too loud. the headphones itself required me to go from 50 volume to around 36 but here still some sounds gets boosted too much.
all in all if u are on a budget get this. Gadgetbyte rated it no.1 too so there's that too.😂

I've been using this mouse over exactly one year now with no issue at all. However, there's just one thing you might wanna know - each of the mouse buttons has two tiny metal plates/conductors INSIDE the button of the mouse (they touch each other to click), which become layered by carbon over time. I have had to clean it with a piece of paper (just rub it between the metal conductors) once every three or four months. Most people just buy a new mouse every time the button stops clicking/holding properly. I suggest you learn how to clean that up, and you'll save a lot of money. I know it's a weird thing to write in a review, but well, I love doing DIY stuff, so if you happen to be like me, you can search the procedure on YouTube. :)

This is hands down the best looking mouse you can get at this price range in Daraz. I'm really happy with my purchase, although there are a few problems as well (listed below)

Pros:
*Great looking
*Long cable
*6 buttons
*Smooth scroll wheel

Cons:
*The RGB is really very bad. It just switched between 4-5 colors.
*There's a bright spot, as you can see in the image; and it's really distracting.
*There's no hardware button to turn off RGB. You can turn it off with the software though.
*The software is really bad and doesn't start up when I plug in my mouse. So it doesn't preserve my settings. For eg- I have mapped the side buttons to perform a certain macro. But everytime I disconnect and reconnect the mouse, the buttons come back to their factory settings. Hence I need to open the software everytime I reconnect the mouse.

All in all, if you are a power user and want a good mouse, go for it. If you want a good and colorful setup, maybe go for a mouse that has a better RGB.

I recently tried the Bikini Painless Hair Removal device, and it definitely lived up to its claims. It’s gentle on the skin and effectively removes hair without causing any irritation or discomfort. The biggest highlight for me was that it truly is painless, making the experience so much better compared to other hair removal methods.

Being battery-operated, it’s very convenient to use on the go, and I didn’t have to deal with any cords. It’s compact and easy to handle, which is great for precise hair removal in sensitive areas. The device is also easy to clean after each use, which is a plus.

Overall, it’s a hassle-free, painless option for bikini hair removal, and I’m really happy with how smooth it left my skin.

The Green Airbeat‑520 earbuds offer solid value for budget-conscious users, delivering clear sound with 13 mm drivers, decent dual-mic ENC for calls, and up to 30 hours of total playtime with the charging case. With Bluetooth 5.4 and IPX4 water resistance, they’re reliable for daily use and light workouts. While the design is sleek and lightweight, the plastic build and moderate bass response reflect its entry-level pricing. Overall, it’s a good choice for casual listening and calls, but audiophiles or users wanting stronger noise isolation and richer audio may want to invest in higher-tier models.

Works fine, arrived in good condition, Dafit app lets you cutomize the watch. However, I would like to adress that some software parts need a bit polishing, all the way from bluetooth features to DaFit app optimization. I couldnot start a phone call from the watch once I got connected through the DaFit app. If your connected via the app, ( which is also through bluetooth) your in-watch call dial will show that you are not paired up. If I directly try to connect to the watch's bluetooth from my phone without the DaFit App, it is very wierd and wont even show up(3/5 times)in the bluetooth devices list and even if it shows up it doesnot pair. Had to try multiple times just to get the pairing ONCE. THEN and ONLY THEN will the bluetooth calling from the watch work.  I dont know if its my device (One Plus 7 pro, also tried on OP9,OP8) or the app...so yeah...other than that the screen's gorgeus, a little bit lag  ,nothing profound, water proof works, straps could be better....Solid 4/5....
